title: 113_s961
content: The Act is titled "Health Care Safety Net Enhancement Act of 2013" and is based on Congress's authority to regulate commerce and provide for the general welfare. It also includes protection for emergency and related services provided under EMTALA. Section 224(g) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include provisions for entities described in subparagraph (B) to be considered under paragraph (4) and subject to the same regulations, with exceptions. Section 224(g) of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include provisions for entities described in subparagraph (B) to be considered under paragraph (4) and subject to the same regulations, with exceptions related to items and services furnished to individuals under section 1867 of the Social Security Act and post stabilization services. The amendment to Section 224(g) of the Public Health Service Act includes provisions for entities described in subparagraph (B) to be subject to regulations, with exceptions related to services under the Social Security Act. The paragraph applies only to causes of action after January 1, 2014, and exempts paragraph (5) in certain cases. The Attorney General, in consultation with the Secretary, shall make separate estimates and establish separate funds for entities described in subparagraph (B) and paragraph (4), with appropriations being separate for entities in subparagraph (B). Entities described in subparagraph (B) include hospitals, emergency departments under section 1867 of the Social Security Act, and physicians or physician groups. The Secretary may establish a fund exceeding $10,000,000 for these entities in a fiscal year, and subsection (m) does not apply to them. Entities described in subparagraph (B) include hospitals, emergency departments, and physicians or physician groups. A physician or group can be an on-call provider if they have privileges at a hospital or emergency department under section 1867 of the Social Security Act and are ready to provide services as needed. Post-stabilization services are provided to individuals treated in hospitals or emergency departments, related to the condition treated and aimed at maintaining or improving the individual's health. The Secretary is not authorized to make payments to entities without budget authority provided in advance by appropriation Acts. Total payments for a fiscal year are limited to the amount appropriated for that purpose. If payments exceed the appropriated amount, the Secretary must take necessary steps to ensure compliance. The Secretary can only make payments if budget authority is provided in advance by appropriation Acts. Payments for a fiscal year are limited to the appropriated amount.
